english: Qin (state/dynasty); surname; Shaanxi (abbrev); ancient feudal state

etymology.description: ideogrammic: 午 (pestle) + 廾 (two hands) + 禾禾 (grain); later 午+廾 fused as 𡗗.
etymology.interpretation: Shows two hands using a pestle to pound grain, a visual of processing/husking grain. The graph later became the name of the Qin polity and dynasty; in modern form the hand-and-pestle elements have merged into 𡗗 above 禾.

examples.chinese: 秦朝统一六国(秦朝統一六國)。
examples.english: The Qin dynasty unified the six states.

examples.chinese: 我很喜欢秦腔(我很喜歡秦腔)。
examples.english: I really like Qin opera (from Shaanxi).
